meanings.definition: Covered with or characterized by scrub.
meanings.sent1: The forest floor was much scrubbier than the lush meadow.
meanings.sent2: The desert plants were scrubbier than the tropical flowers.
meanings.sent3: The scrubbier bushes looked like they needed a good haircut.
meanings.sent4: His hands felt scrubbier than sandpaper after working in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The old painting had a scrubbier texture than the new one.

meanings.sent1: The scrubbier car struggled to keep up with the sleek sports cars.
meanings.sent2: The scrubbier fabric tore easily compared to the sturdy material.
meanings.sent3: The scrubbier toy fell apart after just a few uses.
meanings.sent4: Her scrubbier phone couldn't handle the latest apps like the newer models.
meanings.sent5: The scrubbier house lacked the charm of the well-maintained cottages.

meanings.definition: Having a rough or unkempt appearance.
meanings.sent1: The scrubbier dog had tangled fur and muddy paws.
meanings.sent2: The scrubbier garden was overgrown with weeds and wildflowers.
meanings.sent3: Despite his scrubbier appearance, he had a heart of gold.
meanings.sent4: The scrubbier path was littered with fallen branches and leaves.
meanings.sent5: Her scrubbier hair stuck out in all directions, giving her a wild look.
